instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
damaged area Uf100/uf000 , Uf400/Uf500, no DZF691 in place , on usbc0 got 5,12v macbook take stedy 0.37A on usb1 jumping 5.10-5.20v and jumping 0-0.44 A
cc350-1,31v
cc721 usbc1 connected - V not stable, jumping between12,32 - 8.04 , when usbc0 connected 2.7v and going down
l5820 usbc1 - 3.8v , usbc0 - 1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Both USB-C ports must have the same behavior.
Compare diode mode readings around UF400/500.
Do the same for UF000/100.

Should be good to compare diode mode readings on JF600 with good board.
